text: today I'm making cupcakes everybody's
favorite but it's a little bit of a
twist on a cupcake because it's a
cappuccino cupcake which i think is just
a little bit more sophisticated than
your average cupcake to start off with
you want to whisk three cups of cake
flour and then to that add one
tablespoon of baking powder and 1/2 a
teaspoon of fine salt if you're using
coarse you can use a teaspoon whisk your
dry ingredients together and then over
here in my mixer I have two sticks of
unsalted butter that's room temperature
and one in 3/4 cups of sugar you want to
beat those until they're light and
fluffy or cream them I always get so
excited when my butter is actually
room-temperature it really doesn't take
very long to cream and then you can add
your eggs one at a time I have four
large eggs and two large yolks here I've
told you this before but if you crack
them into a glass measuring cup they'll
drop out a measuring cup one at a time
so you can crack them all ahead of time
last eggs and then a tablespoon of
vanilla this is a really big recipe it
makes 24 cupcakes so it's a lot of
ingredients scrape down the bowl one
more time before you start adding your
dry ingredients what you want to do is
add your dry ingredients alternating
with your wet ingredients with one and a
half cups of buttermilk so add your dry
first the mixture is going to look a
little bit broken right now that's okay
once you add your dry ingredients and
will all come back together it all works
out at the end
so you add about a third of the flour
half the buttermilk third of the flour
half the buttermilk and so on this is a
great basic cupcake batter and you could
bake them off just like this if you
wanted a vanilla cupcake we also have
some other variations on this batter on
our website Martha Stewart comm after I
add the flour I will add the flavoring
it's three tablespoons of instant
espresso powder add two teaspoons of hot
water to dissolve it you can stir it
around and then it's going to go right
into the batter and then you also add
five ounces of chopped bittersweet or
semi-sweet chocolate you could also use
chocolate chips beat combined
this recipe like I said it makes 24
doesn't that look good
you want to fill your cupcake liners
about two-thirds full with batter and
have your oven preheating to 350 degrees
get your cupcakes into the oven and bake
them until the top springs back or a
cake tester inserted in the center comes
out clean about 20 minutes when they're
cool you get to make a frosting and
today I'm making like a 7-minute
frosting it's basically just a meringue
combined five large egg whites with one
and a third cups of sugar and you want
to do that in a key proof bowl set over
simmering water
don't let the bottom of the bowl touch
the water and you whisk and whisk and
whisk until the sugar dissolves and the
mixture is warm to the touch
that can take like three minutes or less
also add a half a teaspoon of cream of
tartar and then just whisk it the cream
of tartar will make your meringue nice
and strong the only real way to tell if
the sugar is dissolved is to put your
finger in there which makes it so that
your finger is really sticky but it's
really the only way that you can tell I
think we're good get this out of the way
and then put it on to your mixer you can
do this with a hand mixer as well
now you just beat this until stiff
glossy peaks form
depending on the strength of your mixer
this can take three to five to even
eight minutes this is looking nice and
thick let's see is it done
get that I'm going to type the frosting
on you could spoon it on or whatever you
want but I like the way that it looks if
you pipe it on so I have a pastry bag
with I would say this is about a three
quarter inch tip and I put it into a
quart container and then folded the
edges down that makes it easier to get
the frosting into the bag keeps the
edges of the bag clean it's so fluffy
it's ridiculous now what you do is you
fold the edges up and theoretically
they'll stay clean squish all the
frosting down and then you just pipe
your frosting on you could use whipped
cream here too if you prefer I actually
find that sometimes meringues a little
bit too sweet and whipped cream is a
really great option of course it is a
lot more fattening final touch a little
grating of chocolate on the top you
could dust with a little cocoa powder
too if you wanted I mean instead or a
tiny pinch of espresso powder would work
that's it they're really cute kind of
sophisticated like I said and I don't
know if they're really delicious I'm
going to have to
oh yeah so good
